section.title: Questions
section.sectiontitle: There are two main types of direct questions: Yes / No questions and Wh- questions.
section.text1a: Are you going to Danka's party on Saturday?
section.text2a: Where did she learn to speak such good Spanish?
section.sectiontitle2: Subject questions are used when the question word (e.g. who) refers to the subject of the sentence. When a wh- word replaces the subject in a question we do not use the auxiliary verb.
section.text3: The teacher told us to go.
section.text4: A book fell on the floor.

section.title: Questions
section.sectiontitle: Use indirect questions when you want to be polite (e.g. when you don't know someone). Use the word order of positive statements. Use if or whether for indirect Yes / No questions.
section.text1a: Can you tell me where the nearest bank is?
section.text2: Does this bus go to Oxford?
section.text2a: I'd like to know whether this bus goes to Oxford.
